SELECT LAST_INSERT_ID()
insert into sys_user (nick_name, phone, email, real_name, `password`, role_id, is_enable, login_error_count, last_login_date, force_modify_pwd, created_at, updated_at ) values (#{nickName,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{phone,jdbcType=CHAR}, #{email,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{realName,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{password,jdbcType=CHAR}, #{roleId,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{isEnable,jdbcType=TINYINT}, #{loginErrorCount,jdbcType=TINYINT}, #{lastLoginDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, #{forceModifyPwd,jdbcType=TINYINT}, #{createdAt,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, #{updatedAt,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP} )
mapper.update: update sys_user set nick_name = #{nickName,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, phone = #{phone,jdbcType=CHAR}, email = #{email,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, real_name = #{realName,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, `password` = #{password,jdbcType=CHAR}, role_id = #{roleId,jdbcType=INTEGER}, is_enable = #{isEnable,jdbcType=TINYINT}, login_error_count = #{loginErrorCount,jdbcType=TINYINT}, last_login_date = #{lastLoginDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, force_modify_pwd = #{forceModifyPwd,jdbcType=TINYINT}, created_at = #{createdAt,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, updated_at = #{updatedAt,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP} where id = #{id,jdbcType=INTEGER}
mapper.select: select id, nick_name, phone, email, real_name, `password`, role_id, is_enable, login_error_count, last_login_date, force_modify_pwd, created_at, updated_at from sys_user where id = #{id,jdbcType=INTEGER}
